title: About Me
text:
About Me
Welcome to my Data Analytics blog! I will be sharing insights, analysis, and projects related to data science, machine learning, and healthcare analytics.

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
text: For this project, I am using the Healthcare Dataset from Kaggle (link). This dataset contains various health-related variables, including patient demographics, medical treatments, and socioeconomic factors.

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
text: For this project, I am using the Healthcare Dataset from Kaggle (link). This dataset contains various health-related variables, including patient demographics, medical treatments, and socioeconomic factors.

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
text:
Step 2: Identifying a Research Question
I am interested in exploring the relationship between socioeconomic status and medical treatment-seeking behavior. Specifically, I will examine: - How income level affects the likelihood of seeking medical treatment. - Whether education level influences healthcare choices.

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
text:
Step 3: Creating a Personal Codebook
To analyze this, I selected the following key variables: - Income Level (income) - Education Level (education) - Frequency of Medical Visits (medical_visits) - Health Insurance Coverage (insurance)

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
section: Step 4: Adding a Second Variable for Analysis
text:
Step 4: Adding a Second Variable for Analysis
To expand the study, I will also explore how chronic illness presence (chronic_illness) affects healthcare utilization.

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
text:
Step 5: Literature Review
A quick search on Google Scholar reveals multiple studies discussing healthcare access disparities based on socioeconomic factors. Some key references: - Smith et al.Â (2021). Socioeconomic Barriers in Healthcare Access. Journal of Public Health. - Johnson & Lee (2019). Effects of Income on Medical Treatment Seeking Behavior. Medical Economics.

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
text:
Step 6: Hypothesis
Based on the literature review, my hypothesis is: > Individuals with lower income levels and less education are less likely to seek medical treatment, while those with chronic illnesses are more likely to do so regardless of income.

title: Healthcare Data Analysis: Exploring Socioeconomic and Medical Treatment Seeking
text:
Step 7: Next Steps

Load and clean the dataset.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA).
Use statistical tests to analyze associations.

Stay tuned for the next post where I will visualize and analyze the dataset!
